original: Lagerfelt, Greta Elizabeth, friherrinna, Duseborg, Gammalkil, f. 13/1/84 i Sthlm av kapt. J. A. Berg o. Helen Bligh. G. 14 m. frih. Claès L. L. — Ex. fr. Anna Sandströms sem. 03, sjukv :kurser. Talrika, ibl. långvar., resor i de fl. av Europ. länder 89-47, stud :res. t. Polen o. Galizien 20-22 (på uppdr. av ärkebisk. Nathan Söder- blom 20, ävenså t. Ital. s :a år). Sekr. i SvRK Lidingö-krets 12-14, bild. RK-krets. i Enköpings-Näs 15, ordf. t. 21, bild. RK-krets. i Valkebo 38, ordf. sed. 38, ordf. i Valkebo lokravd. av fören. östergötl. barn sed. 29, v. ordf. i Gam-malkils sjuksk :fören. 24-31, ordf. sed. 31, ordf. i Gammalkils sjukvrstyr. sed. 29, ordf. i Gammalkils orgelrest :komm. sed. 36, i kyrkorest :komm. sed. 38, led. av styr. f. Birgittastift., östergötl. hembrförb. o. stift. Vadstena hospits, led. av Gammalkils fattigv :styr. 30-46, fornminnesvårdare f. Gammalkil. Skr.: övers. Albert Schweitzer: Mellan urskog o. vatten, Minnen från min barndoms- o. ungdrtid. Brev från Afrikas urskog, Nya brev fr. Afrikas urskog, Ur mitt liv och tänkande, utg. skriftser.: Meddelande från Albert Schweitzer, utg. o. medarb. i verket: Albert Schweitzer, mannen o. hans gärning, art. i kyrkl. o. andra ämnen i ett flert. tidskr. ,ss. Ord o. Bild, Turistfören. Årsskrift m. fl. FMM 40.
translated: Lagerfelt, Greta Elizabeth, Baroness, Duseborg, Gammalkil, born on January 13, 1884 in Stockholm, daughter of Captain J. A. Berg and Helen Bligh. Married on the 14th of <year> to Baron Claes L. L. — Graduate from Anna Sandström's seminar in 1903, attended medical courses. Made numerous, sometimes prolonged, trips to various European countries from 1889 to 1947, studying tours to Poland and Galicia from 1920 to 1922 (on assignment by Archbishop Nathan Söderblom in 1920, as well as for her own research in Italy from 1921). Secretary in the Swedish Red Cross Lidingö district from 1912 to 1914, formed the Red Cross district in Enköping-Näs in 1915, served as its chairman until 1921, formed the Red Cross district in Valkebo in 1938, and has been the chairman since 1938, also serving as the chairman of the local council for the East Gothland county association of children since 1929, vice-chairman of the Gammalkil nursing school association from 1924 to 1931, and chairman since 1931, chairman of the Gammalkil medical board since 1929, chairman of the Gammalkil organ restoration committee since 1936, and the church choir committee since 1938, member of the governing board for Birgitta Foundation, East Gothland home economy association, and the Vadstena Hospice, member of the Gammalkil poor relief board from 1930 to 1946, antiquarian for Gammalkil. Written works include translations of Albert Schweitzer's "Between Primeval Forest and Water: Memories from my Childhood and Youth," "Letters from Africa's Primeval Forest," "New Letters from Africa's Primeval Forest," and "From my Life and Thoughts," published writings: "Communication from Albert Schweitzer," editor and contributor of the work "Albert Schweitzer, the man and his achievements," articles on church and other subjects in several magazines, such as "Word and Image," "Tourist Association Yearbook," and others. Female Member of the Swedish Medical Society since 1940.
